text: Hi all, my marketing team just used Content Staging to launch some pages, in the launched they changed the URLs but when the pages went live, there were not auto-redirects created by HubSpot. Isn’t that suppose to auto-generated by the system? I know if you change a Published page URL, it creates a auto-redirect of that old URL to the new one, why wouldn’t it do that for the Content Staged pages that are going live?

<@UF6M5BW4C> sometimes it can take some time for the redirects to show up. It could also be cached on your system. Generally when I go live from content staging I'll send a friend a link of the old page about 5 minutes later and see if they redirect
<@U25PYL3Q8>, so it was a solid 20mins and no redirects were created, is it possible our portal has a bug?
whats the old url and whats the new url?
have you searched in the redirects page for them?
well marketing realizing that nothing from old pages were redirecting quickly made redirects manually now
Anytime I've ever changed a url in staging I think I've had issues (not with redirects, but just issues in general) and I like to push from staging to live with the same urls
then change the urls after the page is live

That is how I handle changes like that. Generally if I'm changing urls in staging, then I've had issues with the page not being at the right url becuase the previous page wasn't archived properly or something (that is just my guess)

yeah that is what I explained to them when it comes to URL changes that is the best route, but just so I am understanding, the HubSpot system SHOULD auto-create those redirects or is the expectation is that they SHOULD be created manually
You coudl try emailing support and put some times in there and ask if there is somethign wrong because they weren't created dynamically
My understanding is they should create them automagically
ok I will test on my test portals, see if I get the same result as our paid portals
I have a hardcoded link and HubSpot is adding “__hstc=xxxxxxxxx” at the end of it, how do I remove that from happening
oh I found it under: *Automatic cross-domain linking*
